meanings.definition: In a manner characteristic of imperialism.
meanings.sent1: The ruler acted imperialistically by taking control of neighboring lands.
meanings.sent2: The country expanded imperialistically by annexing territories.
meanings.sent3: The cat behaved imperialistically by claiming all the sunny spots in the house.
meanings.sent4: The vines grew imperialistically, wrapping around everything in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The storm raged imperialistically, dominating the sky with its dark clouds.

meanings.definition: In a way that seeks to extend power or influence over other countries.
meanings.sent1: The corporation operated imperialistically, aiming to control global markets.
meanings.sent2: The empire conquered new lands imperialistically, imposing its rule.
meanings.sent3: The child played imperialistically, trying to be the leader in every game.
meanings.sent4: The music spread imperialistically, capturing the hearts of listeners worldwide.
meanings.sent5: The athlete competed imperialistically, striving to surpass all opponents.
